email.common.title: Email Routing
email.common.description: Create custom email addresses for your domain and route incoming emails to your preferred mailbox.

email.root.toasts.dns_locked: MX DNS Records have been locked and cannot be edited.

email.root.toasts.enabled: Email Routing is enabled and routing emails.

email.banner.area1: New! Add zone to Cloudflare Email Security waitlist to improve your email security. Join Waitlist.
email.banner.dmarc_management_now_aval: DMARC Management is now available! <0>Share your thoughts with us.</0>
email.workers_waitlist.benefits.benefit1: Powered by Cloudflare Workers. Flexible, secure and incredibly fast.
email.workers_waitlist.benefits.benefit2: Familiar and Simple. Use one of our starter templates or write your own JS, Rust, C, or C++ code.
email.workers_waitlist.benefits.benefit3: Free Tier. Process up to 100,000 emails/day for free.
email.welcome_page.benefits.benefit1: Private by design. We don't store or look into your emails.
email.welcome_page.benefits.benefit2: Straightforward and free. Anyone can create addresses for their domain.
email.welcome_page.benefits.benefit3: Delivered to your preferred mailbox. Route to the mailbox you use the most, like Gmail or Outlook.

The subdomain will be deleted from the table.
email.disable.option.unlock.title: Unlock and keep DNS records
email.disable.option.unlock.description: Select this option if you plan to migrate to another provider by adding new records before removing Email Routing records. Modifying MX records will disable the Email Routing service.
email.enable.title: Enable Email Routing
email.enable.delete.title: Delete conflicting DNS records
email.enable.delete.description: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to function properly. The records listed below were found on the DNS for %{zone}. Before Email Routingu2019s DNS records can be added, these records must be deleted.
email.enable.add.title: Add Email Routing DNS records
email.enable.add.description: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to function properly. MX records allow your domain to receive email. The TXT record is configured to allow your domain to send incoming emails out to your preferred email provider.
email.enable.fix_multiple_spf.title: Delete multiple SPF records
email.enable.fix_multiple_spf.descriptio: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to function properly. The records listed below were found on the DNS for %{zone}. Multiple SPF records are not valid for Email Routing to work properly, even though the correct one exists. Before Email Routingu2019s SPF record can be added, these records must be deleted.

email.subdomain.create.subdomain.label: Subdomain
email.subdomain.preview_records.descript: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to function properly. email.logs.card.title: Activity Log
email.logs.table.empty: No logs were found matching the selected filters.
email.logs.table.api_outage: The Email Routing Logs API is currently unavailable. Please check again shortly or check our status page).
email.logs.table.expand.spf.fail: A "fail" result is an explicit statement that the client is not authorized to use the domain in the given identity.
email.logs.table.expand.spf.softfail: A "softfail" result is a weak statement by the publishing ADMD that the host is probably not authorized. It has not published a stronger, more definitive policy that results in a "fail".
email.logs.table.expand.spf.temperror: A "temperror" result means the SPF verifier encountered a transient (generally DNS) error while performing the check. A later retry may succeed without further DNS operator action.
email.logs.table.expand.spf.permerror: A "permerror" result means the domain's published records could not be correctly interpreted. This signals an error condition that definitely requires DNS operator intervention to be resolved.

email.dns_records.card.title: Email DNS records
email.dns_records.card.description.loadi: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to be able to receive and route emails appropriately.
email.dns_records.card.description.locke: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to be able to receive and route emails appropriately. Proceeding will give you the option to delete or unlock required records for editing.
email.dns_records.card.description.unloc: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to be able to receive and route emails appropriately. Proceeding will lock your MX DNS records to prevent Email Routing from becoming misconfigured.
email.dns_records.card.description.misco: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to be able to receive and route emails appropriately. Proceeding will guide you to add the required DNS records and configure Email Routing.
email.dns_records.card.how_add: You can automatically add these records to your DNS, or manually create new records on the DNS page.

email.dns_records.card.conflicting_multi: The records listed below were found on the DNS for %{zone}. Multiple SPF records are not valid for Email Routing to work properly, even though the correct one exists. To enable Email Routing, click Fix records.

email.settings.header.domain.title: Domain
email.settings.header.domain.description: A combination of MX and TXT records need to be added to your DNS for Email Routing to be able to receive and route emails appropriately. Domain must be enabled for all subdomains to work.
email.settings.header.subdomain.title: Subdomains
email.settings.header.subdomain.descript:
Enable your subdomains by adding MX and TXT record.
Subdomains are dependent on domain. If domain is disabled, subdomains will be disabled too.
email.workers.header.title: Email Workers
email.workers.header.description: Email Workers allow you to create custom scripts and process your emails according to your specific requirements. Need more advanced features? Go to Cloudflare Workers.
email.workers.header.info: Email Workers share the same price plan as Cloudflare Workers.
email.workers.create_success_toast: The email worker is successfully created. Click Create route to have emails send to the email worker.
email.workers.no_results: No email Workers available. Click Create to start.

email.worker_new.header.description: Email Workers allow you to create custom scripts to handle your emails in different ways.

email.worker_new.create.worker.1.descrip: Email Worker that allows you to add emails to your approved senders list and keep them out of the junk folder.
email.worker_new.create.worker.2.title: Blocklist senders
email.worker_new.create.worker.2.descrip: Email Worker that allows you to block spam. The email messages wonu2019t be delivered to your inbox.

email.workers.intro.card.description: Email Worker is a Worker. Custom scripts you create here will be shown on the Worker's dashboard.
email.workers.intro.description.steep1: Write custom code to process incoming emails.
email.workers.intro.description.steep2: Create a custom address and send emails to the Worker.

email.security.overview.benefits.benefit:
**Stop phishing attacks before damage.**
Proactively hunt for attacker and discover email fraud attempts.

**Fits into any email security stack.**
Deploy in minutes without any hardware, agents, or appliances.

**Configure SPF, DKIM and DMARC.**
<0>Use the Email Security DNS Wizard to protect your organization through SPF, DKIM and DMARC policies.
**DMARC Management.**<0>Set up DMARC Management</0> to see and manage who sends emails from your domain.
email.security.overview.description: Secure user inboxes, adopt a proactive security posture, and save time on email security operations.
email.security.overview.title: Cloudflare Email Security
email.security.overview.enterprise.title: Email Security Enterprise
email.security.overview.enterprise.dmarc: Set up DMARC Management to see and manage who sends emails from your domain.
email.security.overview.enterprise.fits_: Fits into any email security stack
Deploy in minutes without any hardware, agents, or appliances.
email.security.overview.enterprise.stop_: Proactively hunt for attacker and discover email fraud attempts.
email.security.overview.scan_description: Easily scan your inbox for possible threats for the past %{smart_count} days using our ***Retro Scan*** tool.
email.security.onboarding.title: DMARC Management
email.security.onboarding.description: DMARC Management helps you track third parties who are sending emails on your behalf.
email.security.onboarding.benefits.benef: Identify and track third-party senders who send emails on your behalf.
Prevent email spoofing & email phishing. Get insights from reports and modify DNS records.
Review deliverability reports for messages. View the DMARC pass and fail rate for each source.
email.security.dmarc_reports.title: DMARC Management
email.security.dmarc_reports.description: DMARC Management helps you track third parties who are sending emails on your behalf.
email.security.dmarc_reports.overview.an: Weu2019re waiting for the first DMARC report. It normally takes 24 hours for the first results to come in.
email.security.dmarc_reports.overview.dm:
DMARC policy advises receivers how to treat emails sent on behalf of you, but fail to provide sufficient authentication (no SPF and DKIM alignment).
  • None: monitoring only and emails are still accepted.
  • Quarantine: emails are put in the Spam folder.
  • Reject: emails are dropped and not delivered at all
email.security.dmarc_reports.overview.sp:
SPF u201Callu201D policy advises receivers how to treat emails sent on behalf of you, but the senders are not specified on the record.
  • Allow (+all): emails will be accepted
  • Soft fail (~all): emails will be accepted but might be marked as Spam or insecure.
  • Fail (-all): emails will be rejected
email.security.dmarc_reports.overview.dk: DKIM adds a public key to your DNS for email receivers to verify your outgoing signed email.
email.security.dmarc_reports.overview.ta: Below are the top 10 sources sending emails on your behalf. A source must be either SPF or DKIM aligned to get a DMARC pass.
email.security.dmarc_reports.reports.des: DMARC reports show what sources are sending emails on your behalf.
email.security.dmarc_reports.reports_det: DMARC reports show what sources are sending emails on your behalf.
email.security.dmarc_reports.sources.des: The following sources send emails on your behalf. A source must be either SPF or DKIM aligned to get a DMARC pass.
email.security.dmarc_reports.detail.tabl: From: domain: what the recipient sees as the sender's email address
Envelope from: domain: same as u201CMail fromu201D. They both refer to the email address that is used in the SMTP protocol to specify the sender of the email message.
DMARC pass: one or both SPF and DKIM alignment requirements were satisfied.
DMARC fail: both SPF and DKIM alignment requirements were not satisfied.
SPF aligned: For a message to be SPF aligned, the email header From: domain must align with the Envelope from: domain.
DKIM aligned: For a message to be DKIM aligned, the message must have a DKIM signature aligned with the header From:domain.
Reporters are the organizations sending the DMARC reports. Reports are sent by MTAs (Mail Transfer Agent) that have received mail using your domain in the visible From: domain header.
email.security.dmarc_reports.detail.over: DMARC pass: one or both SPF and DKIM alignment requirements were satisfied.
SPF aligned: For a message to be SPF aligned, the email header From: domain must align with the Envelope from: domain.
DKIM aligned: For a message to be DKIM aligned, the message must have a DKIM signature aligned with the header From:domain.
email.security.dmarc_reports.sources_det: Sources are the organizations sending emails on your behalf.
email.security.dmarc.wizard.title: Configure DMARC records
email.security.dmarc.wizard.description: Add DMARC record to start getting DMARC report.
email.security.dmarc.wizard.note.record_: Existing DMARC record found. Click Next to start getting DMARC reports.
email.security.dmarc.wizard.note.multi_r: We have detected multiple DMARC records for this domain. Please make sure you have only 1 DMARC record. Fix in DNS page
email.security.dmarc.wizard.default_reco: There is no DMARC record found on your zone. Cloudflare will add below default DMARC record for you. You can edit later.
Existing DMARC record using CNAME found on your account.
email.security.dmarc.wizard.existing_rec: Existing record found on your account.
email.security.dmarc.wizard.updated_reco: Cloudflare will add an additional RUA to your current record to properly process the DMARC reports. This new RUA won't replace your existing one.
email.security.dmarc.wizard.msg.no_suppo: Currently, DMARC Management doesn't support subdomains. You can only use this feature with your zone top-level domain.
email.security.dmarc.wizard.msg.has_dmar: Existing DMARC record using CNAME found. Cloudflare will remove the current DMARC record using CNAME and create a default TXT record to properly receive DMARC reports.
email.security.dns_records.title: Email security records
email.security.dns_records.description: Protect your domain from email spoofing and phishing by creating the required DNS records.
email.security.dns_records.spf.title: SPF
email.security.dns_records.spf.descripti: The Sender Policy Framework (or SPF) allows you to specify all IP addresses and hostnames that are permitted to send email on behalf of your domain. If you donu2019t configure SPF on your domain your email may be blocked or marked as spam by email receivers.
email.security.dns_records.dmarc.title: DMARC
email.security.dns_records.dmarc.descrip: Domain-based Message Authentication Reporting and Conformance (or DMARC) tells an email receiver how to treat incoming emails from your domain that fail email security checks. You can also specify a reporting email address to receive regular reports about outgoing emails on your domain.
email.security.dns_records.dkim.title: DKIM
email.security.dns_records.dkim.descript: DomainKeys Identified Mail (or DKIM) adds a public key to your DNS for email receivers to verify your outgoing signed email.
email.security.modal.appoved.title: Mark as approved
email.security.modal.appoved.description: If this is a trusted source, you can mark it as approved and the source will be added to the SPF record automatically.
email.security.modal.unappoved.title: Mark as unapproved
email.security.modal.unappoved.descripti: If this is a suspicious source, you can mark it as unapproved and the source will be deleted from the SPF record automatically.
email.security.modal.dismiss_no_rua.desc: Thereu2019s no default RUA found in your DMARC record. You may not receive reports with this configuration.
email.security.toast.missing_rua.msg: Thereu2019s no default RUA found in your DMARC record. You may not receive reports with this configuration. <0>Fix record.</0>
email.security.spf_inspector.title: Inspect SPF
email.security.spf_inspector.description: Inspect SPF records to check if they meet the requirements of a maximum of 10 DNS lookups. If this limit is exceeded, the receiving email server may not accept the SPF record. This puts your emails at risk of being rejected or marked as spam.
email.security.spf_inspector.more_nodes_: More SPF lookups unable to load
email.security.spf_inspector.toast.ok: Your SPF record looks good. It doesnu2019t exceed the maximum of 10 DNS lookups.
email.security.spf_inspector.toast.error: Your SPF record has exceeded the 10 DNS lookups limitation. This might cause security issues. To keep this SPF record compliant, remove unused sources in the <0>DNS page</0>.
email.security.spf_inspector.toast.inval: Your SPF record is invalid. Check again before inspecting.
email.security.spf_inspector.toast.looku: Your SPF record has invalid domains. Check again before inspecting.
email.security.spf_inspector.toast.inval: Your SPF record has invalid syntax. Check again before inspecting.
page.email_routing.description: Create custom email addresses to use whenever you do not want to share your primary email address.

page.retroscan.header.title: Retro Scan report
page.retroscan.onboarding.header.descrip: Scan the last %{smart_count} day of emails for a detailed report on bulk, spam, spoof, suspicious and malicious emails. |||| Scan the last %{smart_count} days of emails for a detailed report on bulk, spam, spoof, suspicious and malicious emails.
page.retroscan.onboarding.section.descri: Analyze up to your last %{smart_count} days of email. Retro Scan will report bulk, spam, suspicious, and malicious emails. This feature is currently only available for Microsoft 365.
page.retroscan.onboarding.section.step_o: Authorize Microsoft 365 mail access and directory synchronization.
Then, choose the domains and time frame you want to scan.
page.retroscan.onboarding.section.step_t: Review an analysis of your inbox, including the users most targeted in your organization and the most common threat sources.
View individual detections for a closer look at potential threats.
page.retroscan.onboarding.section.title: Scan emails in your inboxes for malicious content

page.retroscan.onboarding.step_two.descr: Select the domains and time frame you want included in your report.

page.retroscan.onboarding.step_three.des: Depending on the size of your company and number of users, mailboxes, and emails, this may take a while.
page.retroscan.onboarding.step_three.not: We will notify you by email once your report is ready.
